file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 21-31-09-04 - CONFIG-2 - VACUUM LINE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL VACUUM LINE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the vacuum line. B. The vacuum line is installed below the cockpit, passenger cabin, and baggage compartment floors, and in the rear electronic compartment. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) 21-31-09-000-802-A VACUUM LINE - REMOVAL EMB-135 ACFT MODEL(S) 21-31-09-400-802-A VACUUM LINE - INSTALLATION EMB-135 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 21-31-09 Page 1 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-31-09-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 2. VACUUM LINE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the instructions to remove the vacuum line. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM TASK 23-22-02-000-801-A/400 ACARS PRINTER - REMOVAL AMM TASK 23-24-02-000-801-A/400 CMU PRINTER - REMOVAL AMM TASK 53-01-01-000-801-A/400 COCKPIT FLOOR PANELS - REMOVAL AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-802-A/400 - BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR PANELS - RE- AMM TASK 53-01-03-000-801-A/400 MOVAL REAR ELECTRONIC-COMPARTMENT FLOOR PAN- AMM TASK 53-01-04-000-801-A/400 ELS - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 222 222FF Cockpit 223 223TZ Cockpit 232 232AF/232BF/232CF Passenger cabin 242 242AF/242BF Passenger cabin 252 252AF/252BF/252CF/252DF Passenger cabin 261 261CF Passenger cabin 262 262BF Passenger cabin 271 271CF/271DF/271EF Baggage compartment 272 272AF/272BF Baggage compartment 272 272DR Rear electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially To get access to the rear electronic compart- Ladder 1 available ment EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-31-09 Page 2 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE In the cockpit, passenger cabin, baggage 1 Does the task compartment, and in the rear electronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-011-A (1) On the overhead circuit breaker panel, open these circuit breakers and attach DO- NOT-CLOSE tags to them: • CONTROL (Location tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/APU/CONTROL). • START 1 (Location tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 1/POWERPLANT/START 1). • START 2 (Location tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/POWERPLANT/START 2). (2) Put the ladder in front of the rear electronic compartment. (3) Remove the access panels and door shown below to get access to the vacuum line: (a) Cockpit ( AMM TASK 53-01-01-000-801-A/400): • 222FF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). • 223TZ ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100) (only for aircraft with manual controller installed on the right side of the control pedestal). (b) Passenger cabin (AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-802-A/400): • 232AF/232BF/232CF/242AF/242BF/252AF/252BF/252CF/252DF/262BF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (c) Baggage compartment ( AMM TASK 53-01-03-000-801-A/400): • 271CF/271DF/271EF/272AF/272BF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). • 261CF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (d) Rear electronic compartment (AMM TASK 53-01-04-000-801-A/400): • 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (4) On aircraft with the manual controller installed on the left side of the control pedestal, remove the ACARS Printer ( AMM TASK 23-22-02-000-801-A/400), or CMU Printer ( AMM TASK 23-24-02-000-801-A/400), or control-pedestal top cover, as applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-31-09 Page 3 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-011-A (1) Disconnect the hose (1) (sheet 1, DET. B) from the manual controller (2) (sheet 1, DET. A). (2) On aircraft with manual controller on the left side, remove the bolt (4), washer (6), and clamp (7) (sheet 3, DET. P) from the hose (1). (3) Disconnect the hose (1) from the union (3) (sheet 3, DET. D or DET. N, as applicable). (4) Remove the bolts (4), nuts (5), washers (6), and clamps (7) (sheet 2, DET. L, and sheet 3, DET. E, DET. F, DET. G, and DET. M) from the tubes (8) to (20) and (24) (sheet 1, DET. C and DET. H, sheet 2, DET. J, and sheet 3, DET. K). (5) Disconnect the tubes (8) to (20) and (24) from the unions (3) (sheet 3, DET. D). (6) Disconnect the tubes (20), (21) and (22) from the tee (23) (sheet 3, DET. K). (7) Disconnect the tube (21) from the pneumatic outflow valve (REF.) and remove it (sheet 3, DET. K). (8) Disconnect the tube (22) from the electropneumatic outflow valve (REF.) and remove it (sheet 3, DET. K). (9) Disconnect the tubes (14), (24) and (25) from the tee (26) (sheet 2, DET. J). (10) Disconnect the tubes (25) and (27) (sheet 2, DET. J) from the union (3) (sheet 3, DET. D). (11) Disconnect the tube (27) from the vacuum pump (ref.) and remove it (sheet 2, DET. J). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-31-09 Page 4 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-31-09-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 3. VACUUM LINE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the instructions to install the vacuum line. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM TASK 21-31-00-700-806-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-22-02-400-801-A/400 ACARS PRINTER - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 23-24-02-400-801-A/400 CMU PRINTER - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - AMM TASK 53-01-01-400-801-A/400 COCKPIT FLOOR PANELS - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-802-A/400 - BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR PANELS - IN- AMM TASK 53-01-03-400-801-A/400 STALLATION REAR ELECTRONIC-COMPARTMENT FLOOR PAN- AMM TASK 53-01-04-400-801-A/400 ELS - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 222 222FF Cockpit 223 223TZ Cockpit 232 232AF/232BF/232CF Passenger cabin 242 242AF/242BF Passenger cabin 252 252AF/252BF/252CF/252DF Passenger cabin 261 261CF Passenger cabin 262 262BF Passenger cabin 271 271CF/271DF/271EF Baggage compartment 272 272AF/272BF Baggage compartment 272 272DR Rear electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-31-09 Page 8 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially To get access to the rear electronic compart- Ladder 1 available ment F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE In the cockpit, passenger cabin, baggage 1 Does the task compartment, and in the rear electronic compartment I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-011-A (1) Connect the tube (27) to the vacuum pump (REF.) (sheet 2, DET. J). (2) Connect the tubes (25) and (27) (sheet 2, DET. J) with the union (3) (sheet 3, DET. D). (3) Connect the tubes (14), (24) and (25) with the tee (26) (sheet 2, DET. J). (4) Connect the tube (22) to the electropneumatic outflow valve (REF.) (sheet 3, DET. K). (5) Connect the tube (21) to the pneumatic outflow valve (REF.) (sheet 3, DET. K). (6) Connect the tubes (20), (21) and (22) with the tee (23) (sheet 3, DET. K). (7) Connect the tubes (8) to (20) and (24) (sheet 1, DET. C and DET. H, sheet 2, DET. J, and sheet 3, DET. K) with the unions (3) (sheet 3, DET. D). (8) Install the bolts (4), nuts (5), washers (6), and clamps (7) (sheet 2, DET. L, and sheet 3, DET. E, DET. F, DET. G, and DET. M) on the tubes (8) to (20) and (24). (9) Connect the hose (1) (sheet 1, DET. B) to the union (3) (sheet 3, DET. D or DET. N, as applicable). (10) On aircraft with manual controller on the left side, install the bolt (4), washer (6), and clamp (7) (sheet 3, DET. P) on the hose (1). (11) Connect the hose (1) to the manual controller (2) (sheet 1, DET. A). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-011-A (1) Do the Functional Test for Line Leakage (AMM TASK 21-31-00-700-806-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-31-09 Page 9 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) On aircraft with the manual controller installed on the left side of the control pedestal, install the ACARS Printer ( AMM TASK 23-22-02-400-801-A/400), or CMU Printer ( AMM TASK 23-24-02-400-801-A/400), or control-pedestal top cover, as applicable. (3) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations (Section 6) of the Maintenance Review Board Report (MRB). (4) Install the access panels and door shown below: (a) Cockpit ( AMM TASK 53-01-01-400-801-A/400): • 222FF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). • 223TZ ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100) (only for aircraft with manual controller installed on the right side of the control pedestal). (b) Passenger cabin (AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-802-A/400): • 232AF/232BF/232CF/242AF/242BF/252AF/252BF/252CF/252DF/262BF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (c) Baggage compartment ( AMM TASK 53-01-03-400-801-A/400): • 271CF/271DF/271EF/272AF/272BF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). • 261CF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (d) Rear electronic compartment (AMM TASK 53-01-04-400-801-A/400): • 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (5) On the overhead circuit breaker panel, close these circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tags from them: • CONTROL (Location tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/APU/CONTROL). • START 1 (Location tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 1/POWERPLANT/START 1). • START 2 (Location tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/POWERPLANT/START 2). (6) Remove the ladder from the work area. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-31-09 Page 10 of 10 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
